text: [Music]
okay 26
[Music]
two the process of the film making to me
is is a very long process
it's very well fought out and I think
you you can't plan for everything
because when you get there at the time
things will change but you should have a
good pre-production off the top of my
head I'd say that you know you first of
all you have a good script solid script
write script redraft it redraft it
redraft it till you're happy then it's
locked find your locations go to places
take photos and first of all does it fit
visually with the idea of your script
then does it fit logistically can we do
sound here are we going to have trouble
with background noise um can we get the
cameras in here can we get Lighting in
here casting you might want to use
different different actors rehearsals do
a read through of the scripts so the
actors know what's going on at the same
time you'll be doing shot lists
technical crew doing shot lists and
maybe story boarding depends on on how
you work but that's the kind of you know
standard way of doing it
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
then once technical crew is happy with
they know what they're doing and the
actors are happy that they know what
they're doing locations are set this
level we didn't pay people to come and
act in our films but so we have to look
after them make sure they got food drink
travel expenses they're happy they're
warm they're not freezing cold and we
all day long um and yeah then go for the
shoot and then you shoot and you break
it down into schedules what's the most
time efficient and cost efficient way to
shoot what sections we're going to shoot
in location one and what sections we're
going to shoot in location two and so on
and so on check back the rushes when
you're shooting you might have problems
with continuity you might have problems
with acting you might have problems with
sound lighting so you can go back check
the rushes make sure it's okay and
[Music]
then the editing process which
is another very very long process as
well um very difficult process looking
at rushes paper edit working out the
structure the edit might not work the
same way that the script was was was
made you might have to rearrange slowly
cut the edit down till you get a fine
cut you're happy with it and then you're
going to mix the sound and and and make
sure the sound effects are right and the
dialogue is right and you might have to
do some additional dialogue or you might
have to do some sound effects we call
Foley eventually you'll get to a final
cut and you take it and if you can get
that right then it's worth all the time
and effort that went in and even if you
can't get it right and you learn from it
it's still worth the time and effort
that went in
[Music]
